title: PANICKING FOR PESSAT AFTER PROCRASTINATING!

Hey y'all 
I'm happy that it is getting pooled!
Good for alumini network but that being said : can u check with folks on who actually gets shortlisted?
I've pretty sure, they give a fuck lot preference to main campus.
Afaik, it'll be in the lines of : these are the students shortlisted for tier 1 company xyz : ( this will only include main campus)
Correct me if I'm wrong but instead of relying on the management saying that it'll be clubbed, better to check with someone in 6th sem: what exactly is happening.

I graduated in 2022 - the first time pooled placements took place was for my batch, so I'd say I know what happens. Placements are pooled and there is no way to identify from a company's POV if a student is from RR or ECC. It's been that way for years now for every batch since then. Only PES can identify which student is from campus, the listing by companies includes both campuses always.

That's nice! 
And how's the placement ratio?
Main campus to ecc campus?

I'm mainly worried about the people getting shortlisted.
If ur from main campus: how many people got tier1,2 and check the same with ecc campus.
Some of my close friends come to take interview and I've heard that the bias exists.

There's no official metric, but it doesn't make sense to compute it anyway since the number of CS kids at RR is almost triple the number of CS kids at EC today. Number of RR kids getting selected for a T1 job will always be more because of the distribution.

Numbers will always look skewed here and provide a wrong conclusion.

Hmm.
Ok, I don't know the total count of students from ecc campus but u can just contact a ecc class person and ask how many in their section got into T1,T2 and compare it against your class.

My only reason for pointing it out is because I don't want people to just take ecc considering placements being same for both.
It has been same since forever but when u sit for interviews, you will realise the difference.

As I said, comparing numbers makes no sense cause the distribution is skewed. From a company's POV, they cannot distinguish between a student from RR and EC because both sit for the same tests, both appear for interviews together in the same location. PES does not disclose their campus details. 

You graduated before the changes were implemented. People in the last 3 graduating batches have vouched for there being no difference anymore.
really?  Did you get cse regardless of rr/ec branch
